meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'leary': feeling cautious or suspicious
meanings.sent1: She felt leariest when walking alone at night.
meanings.sent2: He is the leariest person I know when it comes to trying new foods.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave the leariest look to the new dog in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her leariest instincts told her not to trust the stranger.
meanings.sent5: The leariest feeling crept up her spine as she entered the dark alley.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'leary': feeling the most cautious or suspicious
meanings.sent1: Out of all the kids, she was the learier, but he was the leariest of them all.
meanings.sent2: The leariest person in the group always double-checks everything before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The leariest squirrel in the park always hoards the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: His leariest thoughts kept him awake at night, imagining all sorts of dangers.
meanings.sent5: The leariest expression on her face made it clear she was not easily fooled.
